relation: Where Were You When I Needed Your Love
pageTitle: 45cat - The Foundations - Where Were You When I Needed Your Love / Love Me Nice 'N' Easy - Jupiter - Germany - 17 853 AT
textBeforeTable: ♫ Listen To This Record ♫ » Search on eBay  » Search on Amazon 1 Owns Community:   I Own It     I Want It  Collection: 7" Format: May 1977 Date: 17 853 AT Catalogue: Germany Country:   Jupiter Label: The Foundations Artist: Record Details My 45cat Members Forums Add 45 Search Explore Home (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
textAfterTable: Notes Where Were You When I Needed Your Love was a contender to represent the UK at the 1977 Eurovision Song Contest but was eventually placed 3rd from 12 entries at the 'A Song For Europe' national selection show held on March 9th at the New London Theatre, hosted by Terry Wogan. Due to a strike, the contest was never shown on TV, but it was broadcast on the radio. The winning song Rock Bottom by Lynsey De Paul and Mike Moran was chosen by the votes of 14 regional juries.
